Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 1.0.2 Windows 64-bit

What Happens: Log Spam

Mods / Add-Ons: All Stock when the logs were created

Steps to Replicate: Unknown

Result: Log is spammed with 2 different error messages when a specific craft is active which causes the fps to drop heavily.

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

 at ModuleDockingNode.<setupfsm>m__165 (.KFSMState st) [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename></setupfsm>

 at KerbalFSM.updateFSM (KFSMUpdateMode mode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename>

 at KerbalFSM.UpdateFSM () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename>

 at ModuleDockingNode.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename>

(Filename: Line: -1)

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

 at ModuleDockingNode.<setupfsm>m__157 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename></setupfsm>

 at KerbalFSM.FixedUpdateFSM () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename>

 at ModuleDockingNode.FixedUpdate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0 </filename>

(Filename: Line: -1)

Image of the craft: [http://imgur.com/qvDJBF7](http://imgur.com/qvDJBF7)

KSP.txt: [http://hastebin.com/iyowurixos.vbs](http://hastebin.com/iyowurixos.vbs)

output\_log.txt: [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8804898/output_log.txt](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8804898/output_log.txt)

persistent.sfs: [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8804898/persistent.sfs](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8804898/persistent.sfs)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-21T19:23:27Z" title="05/21/2015 07:23  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 21, 2015</time> by Marc010**

The fix described here [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116212-Docking-port-error-spam](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116212-Docking-port-error-spam)

does not work for me as my save file does not contain the word 'aquire'.

Hi Marc010, you're using a save from a modded game, you may have to back up the save and edit out any references to addons.

    [ERR 20:59:51.329] Cannot find a Module of typename 'KerbalAlarmClockScenario'

@sal\_vager

I fixed it by searching for acquire (and not aquire) in the save and changing it to 'ready'.

Would still be nice if this bug would be fixed someday.

I think it may be related to using multiple docking nodes and chaning the root in the editor (just a guess).
